section.title: Other phrases for comparing
section.sectiontitle: We use (exactly) the same as when there is no difference between two things.
section.text2a: Your watch is exactly the same as mine.
section.sectiontitle2: We use very similar to/almost the same as when things are nearly the same.
section.text3a: Their new car is similar to their old car.
section.text4a: The train times are about the same as before.

section.title: Other phrases for comparing
section.sectiontitle: We use slightly different from when there is a small difference between two things.
section.text1a: The new timetable is slightly different from the old one.
section.sectiontitle2: We use completely different from when there is a big difference between two things.
section.text3a: The new stadium's completely different from the old one.
